intro: Rinorea zenkeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually borne on short pedicels and are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Rinorea zenkeri is valued both for its ornamental beauty and its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
